laboratory_examinations.procedure_name: MRI of the brain with gadolinium
laboratory_examinations.findings: An 18 /H1100320/H1100321-mm enhancing mass that displaced the right optic nerve and demonstrated flow void on T2 imaging consistent with a hemangioblastoma.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: The patientâ€™s ophthalmic examination and MRI remained unchanged upon follow-up in 1997. In 1998, her visual field defects slightly worsened.

laboratory_examinations.findings: A homogenously enhancing lesion in the suprasellar region, abutting the left aspect of the optic chiasm.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Follow-up MRI 6 months later showed an increase in size of the mass with mild compression of the left temporal region of the optic chiasm.

laboratory_examinations.findings: A 7 /H1100310-mm mass of the intracanalicular portion of the left optic nerve associated with some mild edema of the optic chiasm.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: The optic nerve tumor was unchanged in size, but the chiasmal edema had increased and was tracking further along the optic tracts in January 2007.

laboratory_examinations.findings: A 10 /H110038/H110038-mm enhancing mass lesion involving the left optic nerve.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Follow-up MRI demonstrated a contrast signal change in the region of previous resection that has remained stable for 12 years.
